source_name: Characteristics of the Croatian anchovy purse seiner fleet
source_documentation: Review of 113 purse seine vessels accounting for 94% of total landings

effort_models.name: Landed Catch by engine capacity- Croatian Purse Seine
effort_models.documentation:
Soldo et al 2019 [DOI: 10.32582/aa.60.1.8], Table 1 with std=20% of mean; (but see fig1). 6 hour per set is a guess for future GFW equivalency
Largest engine is 625 kW

effort_models.name: Landed Catch by vessel LOA- Croatian Purse Seine
effort_models.documentation:
Soldo et al 2019 [DOI: 10.32582/aa.60.1.8], Table 1 with std=20% of mean; (but see fig1). 6 hour per set is a guess for future GFW equivalency
Longest vessel in the study is 31m

effort_models.name: Landed Catch by gross tonnage- Croatian Purse Seine
effort_models.documentation:
Soldo et al 2019 [DOI: 10.32582/aa.60.1.8], Table 1 with std=20% of mean; (but see fig1).
 6 hour per set is a guess for future GFW equivalency
 0.019 ~ 52 days per year, fleet average
Largest vessel is 185 GT
